SLiCAPstatespace.py¶

This is to be used to find the frequency constant matrix (which is the inverse of the time constant matrix)

Block2Bstatematrix(rank, q, A, B, var=s)¶

This Function will return Bres from the Laplace transformed state space equation

\[sy=Ay+B(s)u\]
\[v =Cy+D(s)y\]

for The system of equations where y is unknown

\[q = Ay+B\frac{dy}{dt}\]

this equation has the form:

\[\begin{split}q=\begin{bmatrix}X & Y \\ 0 & U \end{bmatrix}y+\begin{bmatrix} Q & W \\ 0 & S \end{bmatrix}\frac{dy}{dt}\end{split}\]

where the block matricies are

  • U: is an upper triangular Matrix

  • S: is a strictly upper triangular Matrix

  • Q: is an invertible Matrix

Parameters

  • rank (int) – This is the rank of the matrix B

  • q (sympy matrix) – Input Vector

  • A (sympy matrix) – the XYU matrix

  • B (sympy matrix) – the QWS matrix

Returns

res: [Bres, known_ys] Bres is a sympy matrix and known_ys is the known y values.

Return type

list

Block2CDstatematrix(rank, known_ys, V, xlen)¶

This Function will return C and D from the Laplace transformed state space equation

\[sy=Ay+B(s)u\]
\[x =Cy+D(s)u\]

This is for The system of equations where y is unknown:

\[q = Ay+B\frac{dy}{dt}\]

which has the form:

\[\begin{split}q=\begin{bmatrix}X & Y \\ 0 & U \end{bmatrix}y+\begin{bmatrix} Q & W \\ 0 & S \end{bmatrix}\frac{dy}{dt}\end{split}\]

where: U: is an upper triangular Matrix S: is a strictly upper triangular Matrix Q: is an invertible Matrix

Parameters

  • rank (int) – This is the rank of the matrix B

  • known_ys (sympy matrix) – Known values of the y Vector

  • V (sympy matrix) – the matrix that relates y and x: x=Vy

  • xlen (int) – the length of the vector x

Returns

res: [Cres, Dres] Cres and Dres are a sympy matrices

Return type

list

Block2StateSpace(rank, vlen, q, G, C, V, u, var=s)¶

This Function will return time dependent state space matricies A, C, Bi’s and Di’s from the laplace transformed state space equation

\[sy=Ay+B_0u+sB_1u+s^2B_2u+...\]
\[v =Cy+D_0u+sD_1u+s^2D_2u+...\]

For The system of equations where y is unknown:

\[q = Gy+sCy\]
\[x = Vy\]

which has the form:

\[\begin{split}q=\begin{bmatrix}X & Y \\ 0 & U \end{bmatrix}y+\begin{bmatrix} Q & W \\ 0 & S \end{bmatrix}\frac{dy}{dt}\end{split}\]

where: U: is an upper triangular Matrix S: is a strictly upper triangular Matrix Q: is an invertible Matrix

MNA2StateSpace(M, q, src, var=s)¶

This function returns A,Bi,C,Di which is the laplace transformed state space representation of the MNA matrix for q=(G+sC)v. Where i is the i’th derivative of the sources from the equation:

\[sy=Ay+B_0u+sB_1u+s^2B_2u+...\]
\[v =Cy+D_0u+sD_1u+s^2D_2u+...\]
Parameters

  • M (sympy matrix) – MNA matrix ie my_circuit.allResults.M

  • q (sympy matrix) – source vector

  • src (list of sympy symbols) – SLiCAP source names; ie my_circuit.indepVars() or my_circuit.allResults.Iv

  • var (sympy symbol) – laplace variable

Returns

res: [Ares,Bres,C,D] where A and C are sympy matrices and B and D are lists of sympy matrices

Return type

list

Vector2srcCoeffMatrices(src, V, var=s)¶

For Vector ‘V’ that is a linear function of the ‘src’ vector and the laplace variable ‘var’ then this function decomposes V to get the matrix Mres where: Mres*src=V. Then it returns the list of coefficent matrices of the laplace variable.

Parameters

  • src (sympy matrix) – This is a vector of sources

  • V (sympy matrix) – The Vector V is a linear function of the ‘src’ vector and the laplace variable ‘var’

  • V – the matrix that relates y and x: x=Vy

  • var (sympy symbol) – laplace variable

Returns

Mres: Mres is a list of Coefficent Matrices that correspond to the basis (s^0,…,s^n) where is the laplace variables

Return type

list

Example

>>> Iv = sp.Matrix(sp.MatrixSymbol('Iv', 2, 1))
>>> A = sp.Matrix(sp.MatrixSymbol('a', 2, 2))
>>> B = sp.Matrix(sp.MatrixSymbol('b', 2, 2))
>>> s = sp.Symbol("s")
>>> ABmat = A+s*B+s**2*A*B
>>> tot = (ABmat)*Iv
>>> Vres = Vector2srcCoeffMatrices(Iv,tot,s)
>>> res= sp.zeros(Vres[0].shape[0])
>>> for i in range(len(Vres)):
>>>    res = res + Vres[i]*s**i
>>> sp.cancel(ABmat -(Vres))
Matrix([
[0, 0],
[0, 0]])
backsubstitute(U, b)¶

Returns the vector ‘x’ to the system of equations: Ux=b where U must be Upper triangular.

Parameters

  • A (sympy matrix) – Upper Triangluar sympy matrix

  • b (sympy symbol) – Inputs of the system of equations

Returns

x: where x a vector

Return type

sympy matrix

Example

>>> a,b,c,d,e,f= sp.symbols("a,b,c,d,e,f")
>>> U = sp.Matrix([[a, b, c],[0,d,e],[0,0,f]])
>>> b1,b2,b3 = sp.symbols("b1,b2,b3")
>>> b = sp.Matrix([[b1],[b2],[b3]])
>>> x = backsubstitute(U,b)
>>> print( sp.simplify(U * x - b ))
Matrix([[0], [0], [0]])
backsubstituteND(U, b)¶

This function is the same as backsubstitute except it converts to num den first. Returns the vector ‘x’ to the system of equations: Ux=b where U must be Upper triangular.

Parameters

  • A (sympy matrix) – Upper Triangluar sympy matrix

  • b (sympy symbol) – Inputs of the system of equations

Returns

x: where x a vector

Return type

sympy matrix

Example

>>> a,b,c,d,e,f= sp.symbols("a,b,c,d,e,f")
>>> U = sp.Matrix([[a, b, c],[0,d,e],[0,0,f]])
>>> b1,b2,b3 = sp.symbols("b1,b2,b3")
>>> b = sp.Matrix([[b1],[b2],[b3]])
>>> x = backsubstituteND(U,b)
>>> print( sp.simplify(U * x - b ))
Matrix([[0], [0], [0]])
findA4(x, b)¶

Returns the Matrix A for A*x=b

Parameters

  • x (sympy matrix) – independent variables vector

  • b (sympy matrix) – Solution vector after multiplying A by x

Returns

A: Matrix which solves A*x=b

Return type

sympy matrix

Example

getStateSpace(instr)¶

Returns the the state space representation of the circuit defined in the instruction:

Parameters

instr (SLiCAP instruction) – Instruction for the circuit

Returns

res: [A,B,C,D, src, Dv] where A and C are sympy matrices and B and D are lists of sympy matrices

Return type

list

Example
